original_title: Customs Seizes Over 4 kg of Hashish in Gift Parcel
original_body_lines: COLOMBO (News 1st); Sri Lankan customs officials have arrested an individual after intercepting a gift parcel containing over 4 kg of hashish.

The parcel, originating from Italy and addressed to a recipient in Homagama, was flagged during routine inspections, leading to its confiscation and the subsequent arrest of the suspect who had arrived to collect the parcel.
Customs Director Seevali Arukgoda, in a statement to the media, confirmed the seizure and highlighted the ongoing efforts of the department to combat drug trafficking.
"This is the eighth instance of drug smuggling intercepted by our officers in recent months," stated Arukgoda.
Arukgoda further revealed that the total value of drugs seized in these eight operations amounted to a staggering 359 million rupees.
